greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest difference between consecutive divisors (ordered by size) of 2n+1.
comment: Equivalently, a(2n+1) = 2n+1 - (2n+1)/p, where p = A020639(2n+1) is the smallest prime divisor of 2n+1.
The even case is trivial: for 2k the largest difference is k.
Successively greater values of a(n) occur when 2n+1 is prime.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n=17, 2n+1=35; divisors={1,5,7,35}; differences={4,2,28}; a(17) = largest difference = 28 = 35 - 35/5.
mathematica: Table[Max@ Differences@ Divisors@ # &[2 n + 1], {n, 66}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 15 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 19 2001
